intro: Pera citriodora, commonly known as the lemon thyme or citronella thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its fragrant, small, lemon-scented leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its aromatic oils have been used in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent. Pera citriodora is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and hardy nature.
